statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 14 \\ -24 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 26 \\ -40 \\ 8 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 14 \\ -24 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 26 \\ -40 \\ 8 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
